Early Access Review
								I thought the negative reviews were basing the game off of very popular publishers like Turn10's Forza series...I was wrong, this game is almost unplayable... Pro's : It's a drifting game.Decent amount of car selectionNice realistic upgrading capabilities, like Valves, Pistons, Camshafts, Crankshafts, Turbos, etc.Free to installThey tried to incorporate real factors like engine wear, tire wear, oil life, etc.Con's : This game is not modeled around any realistic drifting principals...The engine sounds are very annoying.There is no player base.You can't earn enough cash to get a better vehicle without spending real money.Everything basically costs real money.The cars don't even feel arcady, they feel like you took a 64bit game and translated it into a modern dress...Again, the driving characteristics stink...This game is a grind, you get almost nothing per race: 3-4000 credits... This sounds nice until you realize just a set of pistons will cost you around 50,000...When you finally get enough to upgrade your internals you find out you have to be a higher level...All of you money ends up going back to repairing your car 24/7... You tires last about 5-6 races, and cost about 10 grand, so there goes half your money... Then you need an oilchange, another 5 grand, and to service your engine, another 5 grand... You get the point...The game has been set up as a pay to play, for instance it costs you 120 greens to get a new license plate... Which greens can only be bought with your real life cash....This could all be over looked if it was a great game, but I added a tuning kit which added 100hp 100 torque to my engine... And I still get the same characteristics... The drifting feels very unrealistic... You can't use body roll...In real life, I use body roll to get my subaru to lean into a drift and I use my cars weight to continue the drift... In this game, if you use body roll your stuck taking the corner normally but with your tires smoking... Then when you use and E-brake your car drifts for 1 second and loses all of its speed...I thought upgrading my car would fix these issues and make the game playable... I thought that with my torque and hp I could engage a drift by knocking my rear end loose through sheer power... However, the car acts just like before except I can now hold a drift for 2 seconds...I would say, save your time and hardware space and skip on this game... I was honestly hoping for a very nice game to play with but I got a crappy game....

Early Access Review
								I understand that this is an early access title and that with any title in this status there are things that are not going to either be incomplete or necessarily function correctly.  However this game needs so much more development than I think it should even go into early access. After playing this game for a bit over an hour here are my thoughts:* You are restricted to only using the keyboard and you can't even customize it so that if you don't like using the arrow keys you're out of luck* The car models and track models in this game are beyond bland. * The car models (appearance only) are straight rips of real life vehicles. The e190 is a straight rip of a 190 Evo, the Mustang is a straight rip of a Ford Mustang, the Camaro a Chevrolet Camaro, so on and so forth. There is no way the developer paid to license these names or the vehicles themselves. I'll be very surprised if they don't get sued by the various auto makers that hold trademarks on these vehicle likenesses and names. * The only way I could slightly differentiate between each track was what was in the background. The tracks (limited as they were) were not distinguishable or special in any way* There is only one playable race mode and who finishes first has zero affect on the winner. It  simply looks at who had the highest scoring drifts. That makes sense since it is a drifting game but it would be much more of a challenge if placement affected the total score* You can only race one friend at a time. This is beyond silly in the day and age where it's not unusual to have a lobby full of 16 people playing a game, even a racing game* It is far too easy to drift in this game, it takes absolutely zero skill. The slightest tap sends you careening around a corner. I was hoping that this game would actually take some effort and timing to get the best drifts possible but that is not the caseI could go on and on about this game but it is going to need a lot more development before it is even remotely close to something that I would even vaguely consider playing again.

Early Access Review
								As I type this review I've played this game for an hour, I may or may not continue playing.This review is meant more as a first impression review taking in as much as I can and giving as much information as I can think of that's relevant to a review.The garage/menu.With the garage menu it's very easy to soft lock the game by having the tabs at the top to become completely invisible which had happened to my twice when clicking the social tab, or create overlapping texts / menu's (when you click another tab the texts / menu's will remain visible).This didn't actually bother me all too much, I see it as something that could be easily fixed and probably will be fixed in the future.The controls.I like that the controls are fully bindable, however I think it's stupid that one of the buttons to bind is a button to switch from Automatic to Manual, this should just be an option that is permanent because it's unlikely that someone would want to switch between the two on the fly.The car handling.Obviously I only have the default car available with the platform kit that you are suggested to purchase during the tutorial, I feel like the car handling is actually decent, I tend to do a lot of 180's from severe oversteer which I believe is my controllers fault, Xbox One where as I'm used to using an Xbox 360 controller.The pay wall. (The reason I'm giving this game a negative review)If you haven't played the game and manage to read this review then I'll explain the resource system the game has.You have Gas and Tires (as well as Oil later on it seems like) that are resources that are required to participate in races.These resources can be purchased with in game currency or with real money.This might not sound bad and might not even seem bad at first until you think of it in the bigger picture, and the way I see it is that if I'm losing resources while gaining currency and ultimately having to dump this currency back into these resources, how will I ever be able to afford upgrades by using in game currency? Well to answer that, either you dedicate A LOT of time to this game or you simply don't, in other words you use real money. If the game didn't have such a stupid system I would actually consider using real money in the game because I would at least be able to continue playing the game and enjoy playing without having to worry about something stupid like that.Also the repair system is kind of stupid but that's more bareable because you can do the free repair when you aren't playing the game at least.All in all I rate the game a 7/10 as a fun drifting game but a 4/10 for the game as a whole.I'd highly recommend checking out alternatives instead of using any real money in this game.

Early Access Review
								I want to start off by saying I do not recommend this game in it's current state. It has a lot of potential but is lacking a LOT in the current state of the game. It's a really good drifting simulator with actual progression, it's a lot easier when you re-bind the keys from Up, Down, Left and Right arrow to W, A, S and D, but the amount of glitches with the game is insane. I'll go through them in one moment. I want to start by listing my system specs. I'm running the game on maximum graphics, as high as I can possibly get them without an external program.I'm running...Processor: AMD FX 8320 8 Core, 3.5 ghz clock speedGraphics card: Nvidia Geforce GTX 960 SSC ACX 2.0RAM: 16gb DDR3-No SSDI know I only have 0.6 hour's but in that 0.6 hour's I have experienced an entire plethora of glitches.Let's get into this shall we?- First off I launched the game and accidentally clicked the register button before typing in a name, therefore creating an infinite loading error. (I assume the developer has not coded in a proper "I'm sorry, we need you to fill in the required field" notification.) To fix this i pressed Alt + F4, relaunched the game, typed in a proper name and clicked register and continued on my merry way.- It seem's that English is not the primary language of the developer, it's all very broken and hard to understand. I assume he/she is russian because of the amount of russian text in the game on the english version. So either take some classes or get a proper way to translate, or even have someone else do it for you if that is at all possible.- Even with my hardware compared to the recommended hardware on the highest possible graphics I experienced a hell of a lot of frame stutter while trying to drift, not so much to the point that it's perfomance impacting, but to the point where my surrounding's we're all stuttering pretty badly.- There was this thing when I happened to recieve some kind of gift or something, it told me it gave me 2,000 rupee's (The in-game currency, very Zelda like.) but I don't think I got the rupee's. I'm pretty sure it glitched out and did not give me anything.- I would recommend by default having the drive key's set to W, A, S and D instead of the arrow key's.- The graphic's are surprisingly worse than I expected them to be, the screenshot's look really nice even when you boot up the game the background look's really impressive, i'm not saying that's a bad thing, i'm just saying it's kind of weird considering what the recommended part's are to play this game.- Also I was not able to access key features like fullscreen toggle, option's and setting's until I had first completed the tutorial, which was gruesome to get through with the arrow keys.Final Words.If you're considering getting this game, please do. try it out, if you don't like it, just wait a while until it's a clean and pristine version, much better than the one now. I for one really like this game and want to see where it goes as the last drifting simulator type of game I've played was I think The Fast and The Furious: Tokyo Drift or something or another for the Playstation 2.- Message to the developer'sPlease do not get mad at this review, some developer's out there (I'm not naming any) can't take constructive criticism.I really like this game but it needs a lot of work.- SincerelyNinja

Early Access Review
								For everyone, keep this in mind: the game is an EARLY ACCESS, the game isn't complete or even near completion. Things will change, and at this stage is playable but you will most likely not like the state of the game right now.The graphics for the game are not too bad for a free-to-play racing game; more closely to an older racing game from 2004-2006.Loading times are between 10-15 seconds for me, not a big deal. For those who say the game takes forever to load, you might need a better computer, or better internet connection. Quit exaggerating and saying it takes 9 months to load.The controls for the game are simple (driving games usually have simple controls in general) but the in-game mechanics definitely need some work. Using the handbrake can help with drifts, but half of the time I don't even use the handbrake at all, and the car can drift just fine on its own, as long as you have some speed.I wouldn't necessarily recommend the game at this stage, but I am interested in the game and I'd like to see where the game goes in the future.It is DEFINITELY playable, not 100% obviously because it's in early access, but overall it is playable.

High Octane Drift - Early Access - 20/10/2016Wow. After reading all the hate and negative reviews, I thought ok, I'll give it a go just because it's a free drift-only game (which I'd been looking for) and downloaded it without expecting much. Boy was I wrong...I honestly don't know what people are complaing about. This game has been on steam (in early access) FOR NINE DAYS , it's not gonna be the equivalent of the latest big budget racing game! However, that does NOT mean it wont be fun. High Octane Drift really surprised me; it's actually quite well made. The menu looks clean and smart, the driving is fun and the customisation is better than some AAA games. There are plenty of options for tuning, visual customisation and performance parts as well as a vinyl editor! :D The car you drive in the tutorial seemed unbalanced to me, but once you're left to play around with your own car, learning to drift is pretty easy. Online has worked perfectly for me and I've thouroughly enjoyed the online free-roam mode that lets you drift with other players without any time restrictions or elements of competition. Of course, being an early access game, there are bugs. The descriptions are missing and finding your way around the garage menus can be difficult at first (btw, if you want to check your car's condition or maintain it move your mouse to the bottom of the screen!). The game could be improved by adding menu music and garage sound effects etc, and I've had an issue where my car has lost all power while changing between 2nd and 3rd and i've come to a complete standstill. Over time, I know these bugs will be ironed out and improvements will be made. Also, I understand that this game is free and the dev(s) can't survive on praise alone, but I am a little unhappy that there are features of this game that can only be unlocked with premium currency (paid for with real money, though 1 is awarded easch time you level up) and i'd like to be able to unlock everything simply by playing the game. I have seen people complan that they earn Rupees (the earnable in-game currency) too slowly but in my opinion, that aspect is fine. I'm happy to grind for a whole evening just to get that air filter or raise the cash to paint my rims.As someone who is learning to use Unity (the package this game is made in), I have immense respect for the developer(s). You've made a really great start and I can't wait to see where you take this game! It has massive potential.Overall, I highly recommend High Octane Drift. Play it! Go on... now! Stop reading and download it. You won't regret it.

High Octane Drift - Early Access - 20/10/2016Wow. After reading all the hate and negative reviews, I thought ok, I'll give it a go just because it's a free drift-only game (which I'd been looking for) and downloaded it without expecting much. Boy was I wrong...I honestly don't know what people are complaing about. This game has been on steam (in early access) FOR NINE DAYS , it's not gonna be the equivalent of the latest big budget racing game! However, that does NOT mean it wont be fun. High Octane Drift really surprised me; it's actually quite well made. The menu looks clean and smart, the driving is fun and the customisation is better than some AAA games. There are plenty of options for tuning, visual customisation and performance parts as well as a vinyl editor! :D The car you drive in the tutorial seemed unbalanced to me, but once you're left to play around with your own car, learning to drift is pretty easy. Online has worked perfectly for me and I've thouroughly enjoyed the online free-roam mode that lets you drift with other players without any time restrictions or elements of competition. Of course, being an early access game, there are bugs. The descriptions are missing and finding your way around the garage menus can be difficult at first (btw, if you want to check your car's condition or maintain it move your mouse to the bottom of the screen!). The game could be improved by adding menu music and garage sound effects etc, and I've had an issue where my car has lost all power while changing between 2nd and 3rd and i've come to a complete standstill. Over time, I know these bugs will be ironed out and improvements will be made. Also, I understand that this game is free and the dev(s) can't survive on praise alone, but I am a little unhappy that there are features of this game that can only be unlocked with premium currency (paid for with real money, though 1 is awarded easch time you level up) and i'd like to be able to unlock everything simply by playing the game. I have seen people complan that they earn Rupees (the earnable in-game currency) too slowly but in my opinion, that aspect is fine. I'm happy to grind for a whole evening just to get that air filter or raise the cash to paint my rims.As someone who is learning to use Unity (the package this game is made in), I have immense respect for the developer(s). You've made a really great start and I can't wait to see where you take this game! It has massive potential.Overall, I highly recommend High Octane Drift. Play it! Go on... now! Stop reading and download it. You won't regret it.
